author: kfogel
msg: Do one of two compatibility cleanups from issue #1275:
In revision 6749, we taught ra-dav clients to DELETE activities they
no longer needed.  However, servers only learned how to support this
at the same time.  So, a client trying to DELETE an activity from an
older server would get a 500 HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, and would
ignore that error.
After the new server code has been "out there" for a bit, though, we
want to yank the special code from delete_activity() which allows
status=500 to pass through as a non-errorful condition.  500s are,
generally speaking, most definitely the kinds of errors we want to
report.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/commit.c
(delete_activity): Don't special-case error 500,
HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, anymore.  Instead, ignore the result
code of the request and just return any error.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/ra_dav.h, subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/util.c
(svn_ra_dav__request_dispatch): Change parameter's name to 'code_p',
and allow it to be null, to better support the above changes.
Thanks to Mike Pilato for eyes.

author: philip
msg: Follow-up to r7450, change diff tests to match diff output.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_diff/diff-diff3-test.c
(dump_core, test_two_way_unified, test_two_way_unified_suspect,
test_three_way_merge_with_conflict): Replace \n with APR_EOL_STR.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_repos/delta.c
(svn_repos_dir_delta): Temporarily revert the change made in
revision 7462 -- it violates the client/server compatibility policy.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/update_tests.py
(another_hudson_problem): Fix the expected output in light of the
server change reversion.  This will change again when we re-enable
that server code.

author: ghudson
msg: * libsvn_ra_svn/client.c
(ra_svn_get_uuid, ra_svn_get_repos_root): Style police.

author: cmpilato
msg: This commit addresses a couple of issues.  First, there was a reported
problem with inconsistency in the behaviors of:
svn st -u # (where there is a schedule-add-dir in the wc)
svn st -u schedule-add-dir
In looking at this, I discovered a server-side bug with dir-deltas.
No sweat, three-line fix, bodda-bing bodda-*BLAMMO*!  Regression.  Oh
what, pray tell, might be going on now?  Ah, the code that deals with:
svn up -r REV missing-dir # (where REV is a revision in which
missing-dir does not exist)
was expecting the server to do the wrong thing.  Which it did.  Until
now.  From there, it was all a blur of painful update editor coding
decisions.
So, I guess what I'm trying to say is, "Thanks tons, Julian Foad, for
several days of pain that resulted from your keen 'svn st' bug report."
* subversion/libsvn_repos/delta.c
(svn_repos_dir_delta): Oops!  If *both* the target and the source
are missing, do nothing.  Sheesh.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(complete_directory): Take a 'path' instead of a 'bdi' structure
whose only member we use is -- you guessed it -- bdi->path.  Also,
take a new 'is_root' parameter (to keep us from messing with stuff
we're not supposed to).  Finally, use 'svn_wc_notify_update_delete'
instead of just 'svn_wc_notify_delete'.
(maybe_bump_dir_info): Update call to complete_directory().
(do_entry_deletion): New helper, core from the guts of delete_entry().
(delete_entry): Now just calls the new do_entry_deletion() abstraction.
(close_edit): If an update target is still missing after no editor
drive took place, we have to play funny games with "deleted" flags
and all that.  Use do_entry_deletion() to take care of this.
Also, call complete_directory() instead of doing our own
incomplete-flag removal.
* subversion/libsvn_client/status.c
(svn_client_status): Only note that the status target was deleted
from the repository if we aren't about to add it for the first time.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/update_tests.py
(another_hudson_problem): Expect slightly different text now (since
no real update will happen in this case now).
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/update.c
(upd_close_edit): New.
(dav_svn__update_report): Override the default editor's close_edit()
with our own.
